title: Bertrand Prime Avoidance
content: AvoidsBertrandPrimes n k means the product (n-1)(n-2)⋯(n-k) has no prime factor p with k < p < 2k. This is the central condition defining n_k.

title: The Function n_k
content: nk k is the smallest integer greater than 2k satisfying the avoidance condition. It is axiomatised with existence, avoidance, and minimality.

title: Erdős–Graham Lower Bound
content: n_k > k^{1+c} for some constant c > 0. This shows n_k grows faster than any polynomial of degree ≤ 1+c.

title: Adenwalla Upper Bound
content: n_k ≤ ∏_{k<p<2k} p = e^{O(k)}. The product of all Bertrand-range primes gives an explicit upper bound.

title: Erdős Problem 451
content: n_k is superpolynomial (n_k > k^d for all d) but sub-exponential (n_k < e^{o(k)}). The exact growth rate remains open.
